2. Definitions.(5) “chargeable interest”: The **total amount of interest** referred to in section 5, computed in the manner laid down in section 6.
2. Definitions.(7) “interest”:
Means **interest on loans and advances made in India** and includes—
(a) **commitment charges** on unutilised portion of any credit sanctioned for being availed of in India; and
(b) **discount on promissory notes and bills of exchange** drawn or made in India,
but does not include—
(i) interest referred to in section 42(1B) of the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934; 
(ii) **discount on treasury bills**.
2. Definitions.(8) “prescribed”: Means **prescribed by rules** made under this Act.
2. Definitions.(10) Other definitions: All other words and expressions used herein but not defined and **defined in the Income-tax Act shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in that Act**.

3. Tax authorities.(1) Interest-tax authorities: The **income-tax authorities specified in section 116 of the Income-tax Act** shall be the interest-tax authorities for the purposes of this Act.
3. Tax authorities.(1A) Exercise of powers: Every such authority shall exercise the powers and perform the functions of an interest-tax authority under this Act in respect of any person **within his jurisdiction**.
3. Tax authorities.(1B) Jurisdiction: The jurisdiction of an interest-tax authority shall be the **same as he has under the Income-tax Act** by virtue of orders or directions issued under section 120 of that Act (including orders or directions assigning the concurrent jurisdiction) or under any other provision of that Act.
3. Tax authorities.(1C) Jurisdiction for non-income-tax cre: The interest-tax authority having jurisdiction in relation to a **credit institution which has no income assessable to income-tax** shall be the interest-tax authority having jurisdiction in respect of the area in which that institution **carries on its business or has its principal place of business**.
3. Tax authorities.(1D) Control of authorities: Section 118 of the Income-tax Act and any notification issued thereunder shall apply in relation to the **control of interest-tax authorities** as they apply in relation to the control of the corresponding income-tax authorities, except to the extent the Board may otherwise direct.
3. Tax authorities.(2) Observance of Board's orders:
All officers and persons employed in the execution of this Act shall **observe and follow the orders, instructions and directions of the Board**:
Provided that no such orders, instructions or directions shall be issued—
(a) so as to require any tax authority to make a **particular assessment** or dispose of a particular case in a particular manner; or 
(b) so as to **interfere with the discretion of the Appellate Assistant Commissioner** in the exercise of his appellate functions.
3. Tax authorities.(3) Observance of superior authorities': Every Income-tax Officer or Assistant Commissioner or Deputy Commissioner employed in the execution of this Act shall observe and follow the **orders, instructions and directions issued for his guidance** by the Director or by the Commissioner or by the Additional Commissioner of Income-tax or the Joint Commissioner within whose jurisdiction he performs his functions.

4. Charge of tax.(1) Charge on scheduled banks (1975 onwa:
Subject to the provisions of this Act, there shall be charged on every **scheduled bank** for every assessment year commencing on or after the 1st day of April, 1975, a tax (referred to as **interest-tax**) in respect of its chargeable interest of the previous year at the rate of **seven per cent.** of such chargeable interest:
Provided that the rate for chargeable interest accruing or arising **after the 31st day of March, 1983** shall be **three and a half per cent.** of such chargeable interest.
4. Charge of tax.(2) Charge on credit institutions (1992:
Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), there shall be charged on every **credit institution** for every assessment year commencing on and from the 1st day of April, 1992, interest-tax in respect of its chargeable interest of the previous year at the rate of **three per cent.** of such chargeable interest.
Provided that the rate for chargeable interest accruing or arising **after the 31st day of March, 1997** shall be **two per cent.** of such chargeable interest.
4. Charge of tax.(3) Cessation of charge (2000 onwards): Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-sections (1) and (2), **no interest-tax shall be charged** in respect of any chargeable interest accruing or arising **after the 31st day of March, 2000**.

5. Scope of chargeable interest.Chargeable interest:
Subject to the provisions of this Act, the **chargeable interest** of any previous year of a **credit institution** shall be the **total amount of interest** (other than interest on loans and advances made to other credit institutions or to any co-operative society engaged in carrying on the business of banking) **accruing or arising** to the credit institution in that previous year:
Provided that any interest in relation to categories of **bad or doubtful debts** referred to in section 43D of the Income-tax Act shall be deemed to accrue or arise to the credit institution in the previous year in which it is **credited to its profit and loss account or is actually received by the credit institution, whichever is earlier**.

6. Computation of chargeable interest.(1) Deduction for bad debt:
Subject to the provisions of sub-section (2), in computing the chargeable interest of a previous year, there shall be allowed from the total amount of interest (other than interest on loans and advances made to credit institutions) accruing or arising to the assessee in the previous year, a deduction in respect of the amount of interest which is established to have **become a bad debt** during the previous year:
Provided that such interest has been **taken into account in computing the chargeable interest of an earlier previous year** and the amount has been **written off as irrecoverable** in the accounts of the assessee for the previous year during which it is established to have become a bad debt.
Explanation.—In computing the chargeable interest, **no deduction, other than the deduction specified in this sub-section, shall be allowed**.
6. Computation of chargeable interest.(2) Excluded periods: In computing the chargeable interest of a previous year, the amount of interest which accrues or arises to the assessee **before the 1st day of August, 1974** or **during the period commencing on the 1st day of April, 1985 and ending with the 30th day of September, 1991** shall **not be taken into account**.

7. Return of chargeable interest.(1) Mandatory return: In the case of every **credit institution**, its **principal officer** (or agent for non-resident) shall furnish a **return of the chargeable interest** of the previous year in the prescribed form and manner, **before the 31st day of December of the assessment year**.
7. Return of chargeable interest.(2) Notice for return: The **Assessing Officer** may, before the end of the relevant assessment year, serve a **notice** upon the principal officer (or agent for non-resident) requiring him to furnish a return of the chargeable interest of the previous year within **thirty days** from the date of service of the notice.
7. Return of chargeable interest.(3) Revised return: Any assessee who has not furnished a return within the allowed time or discovers any omission or wrong statement in a furnished return, may furnish a return or a **revised return**, as the case may be, at any time **before the expiry of one year from the end of the relevant assessment year or before the completion of the assessment, whichever is earlier**.

8. Assessment.(1) Production of accounts: For making an assessment, the **Assessing Officer** may serve a notice on any person who has furnished a return or been served a notice under section 7(2) (whether a return has been furnished or not) requiring him to **produce such accounts or documents or evidence** as the Assessing Officer may require.
8. Assessment.(2) Assessment order: The Assessing Officer, after considering such accounts, documents or evidence, and relevant material, shall, by an **order in writing, assess the chargeable interest and the amount of the interest-tax payable**.
8. Assessment.(3) Best judgement assessment:
If any person **fails to make a return** as required under section 7(1) (and has not made a return under 7(3)), or **fails to comply with all the terms of notice** under section 7(2), the Assessing Officer shall, after taking into account all relevant material and **after giving the assessee an opportunity of being heard**, make the assessment of the total chargeable interest to the **best of his judgment** and determine the sum payable:
Provided that such opportunity shall be given by serving a notice to show cause why the assessment should not be completed to the best of his judgment.

9. Self-assessment.(1) Self-assessment payment:
Where interest-tax is payable on the basis of any return, after taking into account any interest-tax already paid, the assessee shall be liable to **pay such interest-tax, together with interest payable for any delay or default, before furnishing the return** and the return shall be accompanied by proof of payment.
Explanation.—Where the amount paid falls short of the aggregate of interest-tax and interest, the amount paid shall first be **adjusted towards the interest** payable and the balance, if any, shall be adjusted towards the interest-tax payable.
9. Self-assessment.(2) Adjustment after assessment: After the assessment under section 8 has been made, any amount paid under sub-section (1) shall be **deemed to have been paid towards such assessment**.
9. Self-assessment.(3) Assessee in default: If any assessee fails to pay the whole or any part of interest-tax or interest or both in accordance with sub-section (1), he shall be **deemed to be an assessee in default** in respect of the unpaid amount, and all the provisions of this Act shall apply accordingly.

10. Interest escaping assessment.Re-assessment conditions:
If—
(a) the **Assessing Officer has reason to believe** that by reason of the **omission or failure on the part of the assessee to make a return** under section 7 or to **disclose fully and truly all material facts**, chargeable interest has **escaped assessment** or has been **under-assessed** or made the subject of **excessive relief**; or
(b) notwithstanding no omission or failure by the assessee, the **Assessing Officer has, in consequence of information in his possession, reason to believe** that chargeable interest has escaped assessment or been under-assessed or made the subject of excessive relief,
he may, in cases falling under clause (a), **at any time**, and in cases falling under clause (b), **at any time within four years of the end of that assessment year**, serve on the assessee a notice and may proceed to assess or re-assess the amount chargeable to interest-tax.

10A. Time limit for completion of assess.(1) Time limit for assessment (Sec. 8): No order of assessment shall be made under section 8 at any time after the expiry of **two years from the end of the assessment year in which the interest was first assessable**.
10A. Time limit for completion of assess.(2) Time limit for assessment/re-assessm: No order of assessment or re-assessment shall be made under section 10 after the expiry of **two years from the end of the financial year in which the notice under that section was served**.
10A. Time limit for completion of assess.(3) Time limit for fresh assessment: An order of fresh assessment in pursuance of an order setting aside or cancelling an assessment may be made at any time before the expiry of **two years from the end of the financial year in which the order was received or passed**.
10A. Time limit for completion of assess.(4) Exception to time limit: Sub-sections (1) and (2) shall not apply to the assessment or re-assessment made in consequence of, or to give effect to, any finding or direction contained in an appellate or court order, and such assessment or re-assessment may, subject to sub-section (3), be **completed at any time**.
10A. Time limit for completion of assess.Explanation 1 (Exclusion from limitation: The time taken in reopening the whole or any part of the proceeding, or the period during which the assessment proceeding is stayed by a Court order or injunction, shall be **excluded**.
10A. Time limit for completion of assess.Explanation 2 (Deemed consequence): Where, by an order, any interest is excluded from the chargeable interest for an assessment year, then, an assessment of such interest for another assessment year shall be **deemed to be one made in consequence of, or to give effect to, any finding or direction contained in the said order**.

11. Advance payment of interest-tax.(1) Advance tax liability: Interest-tax shall be payable in **advance during the financial year** in respect of the chargeable interest for the assessment year immediately following that financial year.
11. Advance payment of interest-tax.(2) Instalments:
Interest-tax shall be payable in advance in **three instalments** during each financial year, with the due date and amount payable as specified in the following Table:
| Due date of instalment | Amount payable |
| :--- | :--- |
| On or before the **15th September** | Not less than **twenty per cent.** of such interest-tax Payable in advance |
| On or before the **15th December** | Not less than **fifty per cent.** of such interest-tax payable in advance, as reduced by the amount, if any, paid in the earlier instalment. |
| On or before the **15th March** | The **whole amount** of such interest-tax payable in advance as reduced by the amount or amounts, if any, paid in the earlier instalment or instalments |
Provided that any amount paid by way of interest-tax payable in advance **on or before the 31st day of March** shall also be treated as interest-tax paid in advance during the financial year ending on that day.

12. Interest for default in furnishing r.(1) Interest on late/non-furnishing of r:
Where the return of chargeable interest is **furnished after the due date, or is not furnished**, the assessee shall be liable to pay **simple interest at the rate of two per cent. for every month or part of a month** comprised in the period commencing on the date immediately following the due date, and—
(a) where the return is furnished after the due date, ending on the date of the furnishing of the return; or
(b) where no return has been furnished, ending on the date of completion of assessment under section 8(3),
on the amount of the interest-tax on the chargeable interest as determined under section 8(2) or 8(3) as **reduced by the interest-tax paid in advance**.
Explanation 1.—**“due date”** means the **31st day of December** of the relevant assessment year or the due date for the return in response to a notice under section 7(2).
12. Interest for default in furnishing r.(2) Reduction by self-assessment interes: The interest payable under sub-section (1) shall be **reduced by the interest, if any, paid under section 9** towards the interest chargeable under this section.
12. Interest for default in furnishing r.(3) Interest on late/non-furnishing of r: Where the return for any assessment year, required by a notice under section 10 issued after the completion of assessment, is furnished after the expiry of the time allowed, or is not furnished, the assessee shall be liable to pay **simple interest at the rate of two per cent. for every month or part of a month** on the amount by which the interest-tax on the chargeable interest as determined on the basis of such re-assessment **exceeds the interest-tax on chargeable interest on the basis of earlier assessment**.
12. Interest for default in furnishing r.(5) Applicability: The provisions of this section shall apply in respect of assessments for the assessment year commencing on the **1st day of April, 1992 and subsequent years**.

12A. Interest for default in payment of.(1) Interest on shortfall: Where an assessee liable to pay interest-tax in advance has **failed to pay such tax**, or where the interest-tax paid in advance is **less than ninety per cent. of the assessed interest-tax**, the assessee shall be liable to pay **simple interest at the rate of two per cent. for every month or part of a month** from the 1st day of April next following such financial year to the date of determination of chargeable interest, on an amount equal to the assessed interest-tax, or on the amount by which the interest-tax payable in advance falls short of the assessed interest-tax.
12A. Interest for default in payment of.(3) Interest on increase due to reassess: Where, as a result of an order of reassessment under section 10, the amount on which the interest was payable is increased, the assessee shall be liable to pay simple interest at the rate of two per cent. for every month or part of a month on the amount by which the interest-tax on the basis of the reassessment **exceeds the interest-tax on the basis of earlier assessment**.
12A. Interest for default in payment of.(4) Consequence of appeal/court order: Where, as a result of an appeal or court order, the amount on which interest was payable under sub-section (1) or (3) has been increased or reduced, the **interest shall be increased or reduced accordingly** (similar provisions for notice of demand and refund of excess interest as in 12(4)).
12A. Interest for default in payment of.(5) Applicability: The provisions of this section shall apply in respect of assessments for the assessment year commencing on the **1st day of April, 1992 and subsequent assessment years**.

12B. Interest for deferment of interest-.(1) Interest on deferment: Where the assessee liable to pay interest-tax in advance has **failed to pay the interest-tax**, and where such tax paid on or before the **15th day of September is less than twenty per cent.** of the interest-tax due on the returned chargeable interest or the amount paid on or before the **15th day of December is less than fifty per cent.** of the tax due on the returned chargeable interest, then, the assessee shall be liable to pay **simple interest at the rate of one and one-half per cent. per month of the shortfall for a period of three months** on the amount of shortfall from twenty per cent. or, as the case may be, fifty per cent. of the interest-tax due on the returned chargeable interest.
12B. Interest for deferment of interest-.(2) Applicability: The provisions of this section shall apply in respect of assessments for the assessment year commencing on the **1st day of April, 1992 and subsequent assessment years**.

13. Penalty for concealment of chargeabl.Penalty: If the **Assessing Officer or the Commissioner (Appeals)** is satisfied that any person has **concealed the particulars of chargeable interest or has furnished inaccurate particulars** of such interest, he may direct that such person shall pay by way of **penalty**, in addition to any interest-tax payable by him, a sum which shall **not be less than, but shall not exceed three times, the amount of interest-tax sought to be evaded**.

14. Opportunity of being heard.Requirement: No order imposing a penalty under section 12 or section 13 shall be made unless the assessee has been heard, or has been given a **reasonable opportunity of being heard**.

15. Appeals to the Commissioner (Appeals.(1) Appealable orders: Any person objecting to the **amount of interest-tax assessed**, or **denying his liability to be assessed**, or objecting to any **penalty or fine imposed**, or to the **amount allowed by way of any relief**, or to any **refusal to grant relief**, or to an **order of rectification having the effect of enhancing the assessment or reducing the refund**, or to an **order refusing to allow the claim for a rectification under section 17**, may appeal to the **Commissioner (Appeals)**.
15. Appeals to the Commissioner (Appeals.(2) Form and fee: Every appeal filed on or after the 1st day of October, 1998 shall be in the prescribed form and verified in the prescribed manner and shall be accompanied by a fee of **two hundred and fifty rupees**.
15. Appeals to the Commissioner (Appeals.(3) Period of limitation:
An appeal shall be presented **within thirty days** of the date of service of the notice of demand (for assessment/penalty/fine) or the date on which the intimation of the order sought to be appealed against is served:
Provided that the Commissioner (Appeals) may admit an appeal after the expiration of the said period if he is satisfied that the appellant had **sufficient cause for not presenting it within that period**.
15. Appeals to the Commissioner (Appeals.(4) Hearing and determination:
The Commissioner (Appeals) shall hear and determine the appeal and pass such orders as he thinks fit and such orders may include an order **enhancing the assessment or penalty**:
Provided that an order enhancing the assessment or penalty shall not be made unless the person affected thereby has been given a **reasonable opportunity of showing cause against such enhancement**.
15. Appeals to the Commissioner (Appeals.(5) Procedure: The procedure to be adopted in the hearing and determination of the appeals shall, with any necessary modification, be in accordance with the procedure **applicable in relation to income-tax**.

16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(1) Assessee's appeal: Any **assessee aggrieved** by an order passed by a Commissioner under section 19, or an order passed by a **Commissioner (Appeals)** under any provision of this Act, may appeal to the **Appellate Tribunal**.
16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(2) Commissioner's appeal: The Commissioner may, if he objects to any order passed by the Commissioner (Appeals), direct the **Assessing Officer to appeal** to the Appellate Tribunal against the order.
16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(3) Time limit for appeal: Every appeal shall be filed within **sixty days** of the date on which the order sought to be appealed against is communicated to the assessee or to the Commissioner, as the case may be.
16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(4) Memorandum of cross-objections: The Assessing Officer or the assessee, on receipt of notice of appeal by the other party, may, within **thirty days** of the receipt of the notice, file a **memorandum of cross-objections**, which shall be disposed of as if it were an appeal.
16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(5) Condonation of delay: The Appellate Tribunal may admit an appeal or permit the filing of a memorandum of cross-objections after the expiry of the relevant period, if it is satisfied that there was **sufficient cause** for not presenting it within that period.
16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(6) Form and fee: An appeal to the Appellate Tribunal shall be in the prescribed form and manner and shall, except for appeals by the Commissioner or cross-objections, be accompanied by a fee of **one thousand rupees** (for appeals filed on or after 1st October, 1998).
16. Appeals to Appellate Tribunal.(7) Procedure: The Appellate Tribunal shall exercise the **same powers and follow the same procedure** as it exercises and follows in hearing and making an order on any appeal under the **Income-tax Act**.

17. Rectification of mistakes.(1) Power to rectify: With a view to rectifying any **mistake apparent from the record**, the Commissioner, the Assessing Officer, the Commissioner (Appeals) and the Appellate Tribunal may, of his, or its, own motion or on an application by the assessee, **amend any order** passed by him or it in any proceeding under this Act **within four years from the end of the financial year in which such order was passed**.
17. Rectification of mistakes.(2) Opportunity of being heard (Enhancem: An amendment which has the effect of **enhancing the assessment or reducing a refund or otherwise increasing the liability of the assessee** shall not be made unless the authority concerned has given **notice** to the assessee and allowed the assessee a **reasonable opportunity of being heard**.
17. Rectification of mistakes.(3) Order in writing: Where an amendment is made under this section, the order shall be **passed in writing** by the authority concerned.
17. Rectification of mistakes.(4) Refund: Where any such amendment has the effect of **reducing the assessment**, the Assessing Officer shall make any **refund** which may be due.
17. Rectification of mistakes.(5) Notice of demand: Where any such amendment has the effect of **enhancing the assessment or reducing the refund already made**, the Assessing Officer shall serve on the assessee a **notice of demand** in the prescribed form specifying the sum payable.

Sections.18. Interest-tax deductible in computing: Notwithstanding anything contained in the Income-tax Act, in computing the income of a **credit institution** chargeable to income-tax under the head “Profits and gains of business or profession” or “Income from other sources”, the **interest-tax payable** by the credit institution for any assessment year shall be **deductible** from the income, under the respective heads, of the credit institution assessable for that assessment year.

19. Revision of order prejudicial to rev.(1) Revision by Commissioner:
The Commissioner may call for and examine the record of any proceeding, and if he considers that any order passed therein by the Assessing Officer is **erroneous in so far as it is prejudicial to the interests of the revenue**, he may, after giving the assessee an opportunity of being heard and making necessary enquiry, pass such order thereon as the circumstances justify, including an order **enhancing or modifying the assessment, or cancelling the assessment and directing a fresh assessment**.
Explanation.—**“record”** shall include all records available at the time of examination. Where an order is the subject matter of an appeal, the Commissioner's power extends to all matters that **had not been considered and decided in such appeal**.
19. Revision of order prejudicial to rev.(2) Time limit for revision: No order shall be made under sub-section (1) after the expiry of **two years from the end of the financial year in which the order sought to be revised was passed**.
19. Revision of order prejudicial to rev.(3) Exception to time limit: An order in revision under this section may be passed at anytime in the case of an order which has been passed in consequence of, or to give effect to, any finding or direction contained in an order of the Appellate Tribunal, the National Tax Tribunal, the High Court or the Supreme Court.
19. Revision of order prejudicial to rev.Explanation (Exclusion from limitation p: In computing the period of limitation for sub-section (2), the **time taken in giving an opportunity to the assessee to be reheard** and any period during which any proceeding under this section is **stayed by an order or injunction of any court** shall be excluded.

20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(1) Revision by Commissioner (not prejud: The Commissioner may, either of his own motion or on an application by the assessee for revision, call for the record of any proceeding taken by an Assessing Officer subordinate to him and may pass such order thereon, **not being an order prejudicial to the assessee**, as he thinks fit.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(2) Time limit for suo motu revision: The Commissioner shall not of his own motion revise any order under this section if the order has been made **more than one year previously**.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(3) Time limit for assessee's applicatio:
An application for revision by the assessee shall be made **within one year** from the date on which the order in question was communicated to him or the date on which he otherwise came to know of it, whichever is earlier:
Provided that the Commissioner may admit an application made after the expiry of that period if he is satisfied that the assessee was prevented by **sufficient cause**.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(4) Cases where revision is barred:
The Commissioner shall not revise any order under this section—
(a) where an **appeal against the order lies to the Commissioner (Appeals) but has not been made** and the time for appeal has not expired, or the assessee has not waived his right of appeal; or
(b) where the order has been made the **subject of an appeal to the Commissioner (Appeals)**.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(5) Fee for application: Every application by an assessee for revision under this section shall be accompanied by a fee of **twenty-five rupees**.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(6) Time limit for order on application:
On every application by an assessee for revision (made on or after 1st October, 1998), an order shall be passed within **one year from the end of the financial year in which such application is made**.
Explanation.—The time taken in giving an opportunity to the assessee to be re-heard and any period during which any proceeding is stayed by a court order shall be **excluded**.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.(7) Exception to time limit: An order in revision may be passed at any time in consequence of or to give effect to any finding or direction contained in an order of the Appellate Tribunal, the National Tax Tribunal, the High Court or the Supreme Court.
20. Revision of orders by Commissioner.Explanation (Non-prejudicial order): An order by the Commissioner **declining to interfere** shall, for the purposes of this section be deemed **not to be an order prejudicial to the assessee**.

21. Application of provisions of Income-.Application of IT Act sections and rules:
The provisions of the following **sections and Schedules of the Income-tax Act** and the **Income-tax (Certificate Proceedings) Rules, 1962**, as in force from time to time, shall apply with **necessary modifications** as if the said provisions and the rules referred to **interest-tax** instead of to income-tax:

Provided that references to the **“assessee”** in the said provisions and the rules shall be construed as references to an **assessee as defined in this Act**.

22. Income-tax papers to be available fo.(1) Use of IT Act information for Intere: All information contained in any statement or return made or furnished or obtained or collected for the purposes of the **Income-tax Act** may be **used for the purposes of this Act**.
22. Income-tax papers to be available fo.(2) Use of Interest-tax Act information: All information contained in any statement or return made or furnished or obtained or collected for the purposes of **this Act** may be **used for the purposes of the Income-tax Act**.

Sections.23. Failure to comply with notices: If any person **fails, without reasonable cause, to produce any accounts or documents** required to be produced under section 8, he shall pay by way of **penalty**, a sum which shall not be less than **one thousand rupees**, but which may extend to **twenty-five thousand rupees, for each such failure**.
Sections.24. False statements: If a person makes a statement in any verification under this Act or rule, or delivers an account or statement which is **false**, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, he shall be **punishable with rigorous imprisonment** for a term which shall not be less than **three months** but which may extend to **seven years and with fine**.

25. Wilful attempt to evade tax, etc..Punishment: If a person **wilfully attempts to evade any interest-tax, penalty or interest** chargeable or imposable under this Act, he shall, without prejudice to any other penalty, be **punishable with rigorous imprisonment** for a term which shall not be less than **three months** but which may extend to **seven years and with fine**.
25. Wilful attempt to evade tax, etc..Explanation (Includes):
A wilful attempt to evade shall include a case where any person—
(i) has in his possession or control any relevant books of account or other documents **containing a false entry or statement**; or
(ii) **makes or causes to be made any false entry or statement** in such documents; or
(iii) **wilfully omits or causes to be omitted any relevant entry or statement** in such documents; or
(iv) **causes any other circumstances to exist** which will have the effect of enabling such person to evade any interest-tax, penalty or interest.

If a person **abets or induces** another person to make and deliver any false account, statement or declaration, or to **commit an offence under section 25**, he shall be **punishable with rigorous imprisonment** for a term which shall not be less than **three months** but which may extend to **seven years and with fine**.

26A. Offences by credit institutions.(1) Liability of officers and institutio:
Where an offence has been committed by a **credit institution**, every person who, at the time the offence was committed, was **in charge of, and was responsible to, the credit institution for the conduct of its business** as well as the **credit institution** shall be deemed to be **guilty of the offence and liable to be proceeded against and punished**:
Provided that any such person shall not be liable to any punishment if he proves that the offence was committed **without his knowledge** or that he had exercised **all due diligence** to prevent the commission of such offence.
26A. Offences by credit institutions.(2) Liability of specific officers: Where an offence has been committed by a credit institution and it is proved that the offence has been committed with the **consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect** on the part of, any **director, manager, secretary or other officer** of the credit institution, such person shall also be deemed to be guilty of that offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.
26A. Offences by credit institutions.Explanation: For the purposes of this section, “director”, in relation to a co-operative society, means any member controlling the affairs thereof.

26B. Institution of proceedings and comp.(1) Previous sanction required:
A person shall not be proceeded against for any offence under section 24 or section 25 or section 26 or for any offence under the Indian Penal Code, except with the **previous sanction of the Commissioner or Commissioner (Appeals)**:
Provided that the Chief Commissioner or Director General may issue instructions or directions to the aforesaid interest-tax authorities for institution of proceedings.
26B. Institution of proceedings and comp.(2) Composition of offences: Any offence under the sections referred to in sub-section (1) may, either before or after the institution of proceedings, be **compounded by the Chief Commissioner or Director General**.

26C. Power of credit institutions to var.Power to vary interest rate: Notwithstanding anything contained in any agreement under which any **term loan** has been sanctioned by the credit institution before the **1st day of October, 1991**, it shall be lawful for the credit institution to **vary the agreement, so as to increase the rate of interest stipulated therein to the extent to which such institution is liable to pay the interest-tax under this Act** in relation to the amount of interest on the term loan which is due to the credit institution.
26C. Power of credit institutions to var.Explanation: “term loan” means a loan which is not repayable on demand.

27. Power to make rules.(1) Rule making power: The **Board** may, subject to the control of the Central Government, by notification, **make rules for carrying out the purposes of this Act**.
27. Power to make rules.(3) Retrospective effect: The power to make rules shall, on the first occasion of the exercise thereof, include the power to give **retrospective effect** to the rules from a date not earlier than the date of commencement of this Act.
27. Power to make rules.(4) Laying before Parliament: The Central Government shall cause every rule made under this section to be **laid before each House of Parliament** for a total period of thirty days, and the rule shall thereafter have effect in such **modified form or be of no effect** as both Houses agree.

Sections.28. Power to exempt:
Where the Central Government is of the opinion that it is necessary or expedient in the public interest or having regard to the peculiar circumstances of the case, it may, by notification, and subject to conditions, **exempt any credit institution or any class of credit institutions or any interest on any category of loans or advances** from the levy of interest-tax:
Provided that no such exemption shall be made except on the **recommendation of the Reserve Bank of India**.

29. Power to remove difficulty.(1) Original power to remove difficulty:
If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Act, the **Central Government may, by order**, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, **remove the difficulty**:
Provided that no such order shall be made after the expiry of a period of **two years from the commencement of this Act**.
29. Power to remove difficulty.(2) Power to remove difficulty (after 19:
If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Act, **as amended by the Finance (No.2) Act, 1991**, the Central Government may, by order, do anything not inconsistent with such provisions for the purpose of removing the difficulty:
Provided that no such order shall be made after the expiry of **two years from the 1st day of October, 1991**.
29. Power to remove difficulty.(3) Laying before Parliament: Every order made under sub-section (2) shall be **laid before each House of Parliament**.
